# \# Unity Project Template (Public Version)

# 

# This repository serves as a \*\*standard public template\*\* for creating new Unity projects. It is designed for general use, collaboration, open-source work, tutorials, game jams, and shared development environments.

# 

# It includes recommended structure, safety rules, and version control practices used across the industry.

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸ¯ Purpose

# 

# \* Provide a clean, ready-to-use Unity project foundation.

# \* Ensure all Unity auto-generated files are ignored from version control.

# \* Protect all environment/secret files using standard ignore patterns.

# \* Offer a consistent project layout for anyone cloning or forking the template.

# \* Make it easy to start new Unity projects with no setup required.

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸ“ Repository Structure

# 

# A typical new Unity project looks like this:

# 

# ```

# UnityTemplate/

# &nbsp;   Assets/

# &nbsp;   Packages/

# &nbsp;   ProjectSettings/

# &nbsp;   README.md

# &nbsp;   .gitignore

# ```

# 

# You may add your own folders as needed:

# 

# ```

# Assets/

# &nbsp;   Art/

# &nbsp;   Scripts/

# &nbsp;   Scenes/

# &nbsp;   Audio/

# ```

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸ§° Version Control Safety (Git Ignore)

# 

# This template includes a \*\*Unity-standard `.gitignore`\*\*, designed to keep your repository clean and safe.

# 

# \### âœ” Unity Auto-Generated Files (Ignored)

# 

# ```

# Library/

# Temp/

# Obj/

# Build/

# Builds/

# Logs/

# UserSettings/

# MemoryCaptures/

# \*.csproj

# \*.sln

# \*.vsconfig

# ```

# 

# These files are regenerated by Unity and must \*\*never\*\* be committed.

# 

# \### âœ” Environment \& Secret Files (Ignored)

# 

# All `.env` and variant files are ignored using industry-standard patterns:

# 

# ```

# \*\*/\*.env

# \*\*/\*.env.\*

# ```

# 

# This ensures you never accidentally upload API keys, tokens, or personal configuration.

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸš€ How to Use This Template

# 

# 1\. \*\*Click â€œUse this templateâ€\*\* (if cloned from GitHub) or download the ZIP.

# 2\. Rename the folder to your new project name.

# 3\. Open it in Unity Hub.

# 4\. Start building!

# 

# Optional:

# 

# \* Add a license (`MIT`, `Apache-2.0`, etc.).

# \* Update the README description.

# \* Add your own folders inside \*Assets\*.

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸ“ Recommended Additions

# 

# Public projects may include:

# 

# \* LICENSE file (MIT or Apache recommended)

# \* CONTRIBUTING.md

# \* CHANGELOG.md

# \* Code of Conduct (for larger teams)

# \* Assets guidelines

# \* Naming conventions

# 

# These make collaboration easier.

# 

# ---

# 

# \## â¤ï¸ Contributions

# 

# If this template is used for open-source or collaborative work, feel free to:<br>

# 

# \* Add contributor guidelines

# \* Include basic instructions for building the project

# \* Add references or credits to any included assets

# 

# ---

# 

# \## ğŸ“„ License

# 

# You may publish this template under \*\*any license you prefer\*\* (MIT recommended for public/open-source use).

#

# This template is intentionally simple, safe, and universalâ€”ready for any Unity project.
